title: Human Genome Project
summary: The  Human Genome Project (HGP) was an international scientific research project with the goal of determining the  base pairs that make up human DNA, and of identifying and mapping all of the  genes of the human genome from both a physical and  a functional standpoint.[1] It remains the world's largest collaborative biological project.[2] Planning started after the idea was picked up in 1984 by the US government, the project formally launched in 1990, and was declared complete on April 14, 2003.[3] Level "complete genome" was achieved in May 2021.[4][5]
